result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zeth A. Ashton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Zeth A. Ashton in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Zeth A. Ashton in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF110, 15CM79 and 15CF187 @ 11:51 a.m. Agreement stated - 15CF110 amended information filed. Cts 2 & 3 amended to misd theft. Def will plead to all. Ct 1 defer judgment, cts 2 & 3  withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, restitution, counseling deemed appropriate, costs. Ct 4 and 15CM79 and 15CF187 dismiss and read in. Uncharged referrals recited A15-3648, A15-3743, A15-3734, A15-3653,  A15-3153, A15-3754, A15-3291, and A15-364, to be read in for sentencing. Atty Abernethy-Mays and Def agree. State asks 30 days to determine restitution amount. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to ct 1 - guilty. Plea to ct 2 as amended - guilty. Plea to ct 3 as amended - guilty. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in ct 4 and 15CF187 and 15CM79. Court will also consider uncharged read-ins. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Attorney Abernethy-Mays satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of cts 1, 2 & 3. Ct 1 - deferred judgment. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Court signs deferred entry of judgment agreement. Ct 2 withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, restitution, State has 60 days to determine amount, subject to hearing, counseling as deemed appropriate, court costs, DNA surcharge, credit for 147 days if revoked. Ct 3 - same as ct 2, withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, restitution - on all read-ins - 60 days to determine, subject to hearing. Restitution is joint & several. Credit for 147 days if revoked. DNA sample and surcharge. Postconviction rights.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Review 05/30/18 @ 1:00 p.m. for DEJ.

Attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF187, 15CM79 and 15CF110 called @ 3:44 p.m. Plea/sentencing rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Zeth A. Ashton in court, in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 15CF110, 15CF187 & 15CM79  @ 11:41 am.  Atty Abernethy-Mays files waiver of preliminary examination on 15CF110 & 15CF187.   Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause & binds over.  Informations filed.  Atty Abernethy-Mays has copy of informations, waives reading, reserve all rights & enters Not Guilty plea on 15CF110 Ct's 1-4 & 15CF187 Ct 1.  Court receives Not Guilty pleas on both files.   Atty Abernethy-Mays gives bond argument. State does not object.  Atty Abernethy-Mays replys.  State updates Court on Restitution. Officer Duley talks to DA. Court orders $750.00 cash bond to cover all 3 files.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Zeth A. Ashton in court via video, with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays by phone.  Defendant Zeth A. Ashton in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 15CF110, 15CF187 & 16CM79.   Complaints received, reviewed and waive reading.  15CM79 Not guilty pleas entered.  CF cases, time limits waived for preliminary.  15CM79 court will receive not guilty pleas.  Bonds have been set and will continue.  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Zeth A. Ashton in court, via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 15CF110, 15CF187 and 15CM79.  15CM79 def was in court on May 12, 2015, and copy of complaint provided.    Warrants vacated for all files.   15CF110 Court reads charges with possible penalties.  Def has copy of complaints.  15CF187 Reviewed.  Def advised of right to an atty.   State request 1000.00 cash bond to cover all files.  Reasons given for cash bond.  Def gives address on record.  Bond set by court  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Zeth A. Ashton not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State request warrant, body only.  Court will authorize warrant, adjacent counties.  Body only
